Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.local

Class CryptoUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.util.local.CryptoUtil
  • public final class CryptoUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to group all cryptographic related parameters (pki algorithm, key length, signing algorithm, ...)

      • verifyCryptoACTupleTupleSignature

        public void verifyCryptoACTupleTupleSignature​(@NotNull
                                              @NotNull CryptoACTuple tupleToVerify,
                                              @NotNull
                                              @NotNull java.security.PublicKey keyToVerify)
                                       throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                              java.security.SignatureException
        This method verifies a tuple's signature against the given public key
        Parameters:
        tupleToVerify - the tuple to verify
        keyToVerify - alternative public key to use instead of "this" public key
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        java.security.SignatureException - throws SignatureException

      • signCryptoACTuple

        public void signCryptoACTuple​(@NotNull
                              @NotNull CryptoACTuple tupleToSign,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey signingKey,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull java.lang.String ownerOfTheKey)
                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                              java.security.SignatureException
        This method signs a tuple using the element's private key (the algorithm used is defined in the CryptoUtil class). Then the new signature is assigned to the Tuple, along with the signer (this)
        Parameters:
        tupleToSign - the tuple to be signed
        signingKey - alternative private key to use instead of "this" private key
        ownerOfTheKey - is another key is given, this is the field in which to indicate the ID of the owner of the key
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        java.security.SignatureException - throws SignatureException

      • encryptPKIKeys

        public byte[][] encryptPKIKeys​(@NotNull
                               @NotNull java.security.PublicKey publicKeyToEncrypt,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey privateKeyToEncrypt,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull java.security.PublicKey encryptingKey)
                        throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                               java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                               javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This method encrypts a KeyPair and return two arrays of bytes (the encrypted keys, private and public)
        Parameters:
        publicKeyToEncrypt - The public key to encrypt
        privateKeyToEncrypt - The private key to encrypt
        encryptingKey - alternative public key to use instead of "this" public key
        Returns:
        two arrays of bytes: the public key (0) and the private key (1)
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException

      • decryptPKIKeys

        public java.security.KeyPair decryptPKIKeys​(@NotNull
                                            @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull byte[] inputPublicKeyInBytes,
                                            @NotNull
                                            @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull byte[] inputPrivateKeyInBytes,
                                            @NotNull
                                            @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey decryptingKey)
                                     throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                            java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                            javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                            java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This method returns a KeyPair by processing two arrays of bytes (the encrypted keys, private and public)
        Parameters:
        inputPublicKeyInBytes - The public key to decrypt
        inputPrivateKeyInBytes - The private key to decrypt
        decryptingKey - alternative private key to use instead of "this" private key
        Returns:
        the Keypair, decrypted, null if an exception was thrown
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - throws InvalidKeySpecException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - throws NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • encryptSymmetricKey

        public byte[] encryptSymmetricKey​(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKeyToEncrypt,
                                  @NotNull
                                  @NotNull java.security.PublicKey encryptingKey)
                           throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                  java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                  javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function encrypts a given Secret key (symmetric key)
        Parameters:
        symmetricKeyToEncrypt - the symmetric key to encrypt
        encryptingKey - alternative public key to use instead of "this" public key
        Returns:
        the encrypted key bytes, or null if there was an error
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException

      • decryptSymmetricKey

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey decryptSymmetricKey​(@NotNull
                                                  @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull byte[] symmetricKeyToDecrypt,
                                                  @NotNull
                                                  @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey decryptingKey)
                                           throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                                  java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                  javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function decrypts a given array of byte (encrypted Secret key)
        Parameters:
        symmetricKeyToDecrypt - the symmetric key to decrypt
        decryptingKey - alternative key to decrypt the key with. May be null
        Returns:
        the decrypted secret key, or null if there was an error
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException

      • encryptFile

        public java.lang.String encryptFile​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull javax.crypto.SecretKey keyToUse,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfFileToEncrypt)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                    java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                    javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This method receives in input a path (or ID) of the file to encrypt. It loads it through the DAO, then encrypts it with the given key and save the encrypted copy
        Parameters:
        keyToUse - the symmetric key to be used
        pathOfFileToEncrypt - the path of the file to encrypt
        Returns:
        the path of the new encrypted file, or null if there was an error
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException

      • decryptFile

        public java.lang.String decryptFile​(@NotNull
                                    @NotNull javax.crypto.SecretKey keyToUse,
                                    @NotNull
                                    @NotNull java.lang.String pathOfFileToDecrypt)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                    java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                    javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This method receives in input a path (or ID) of the file to decrypt. It loads it through the DAO, then decrypts it with the given key and save the decrypted copy
        Parameters:
        keyToUse - the symmetric key to be used
        pathOfFileToDecrypt - the path of the file to decrypt
        Returns:
        the path of the new decrypted file, or null if there was an error
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - throws BadPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - throws InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - throws IllegalBlockSizeException
